bool  collapsedToo
)  [protected]
 

ArrayList<Int>* createPath (   ) 
 

Creates a list of positions within the tree field from a root to this item.

Returns:
A list of 0-indexed positions of this item. The first index is the position within the root items list, the second index is the position within the root's child items list, and so on, until this tree item is reached.

FieldElement* edit (   ) 
 

Opens a popup to edit the first editable field element of this cell.

This method is typically called by the list field when receiving the onEdit() event.

Returns:
The field element that is being edited now, or NULL, if no field element is editable.

void ensureVisible (  bool  deeply = false  ) 
 

Ensure that this item is entirely visible by setting the scroll position.

If the item cannot be shown entirely, then the top-left corner is ensured to be shown.

Parameters:
deeply Whether to try to show the expanded children, too.

void ensureVisibleNow (  bool  deeply = false  ) 
 

Ensure that this item is entirely visible by setting the scroll position, bypassing the skin effects, setting the scroll position now.

If the item cannot be shown entirely, then the top-left corner is ensured to be shown.

Parameters:
deeply Whether to try to show the expanded children, too.

int getDepth (   ) 
 

Returns the depth of this item from its root.

The root items of a tree field have a depth of 0.

Returns:
The depth of this item.

void* getModel (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Returns:
The application (or game) defined data.

Item* getParent (   ) 
 

Vector getPosition (   ) 
 

Vector getSize (   ) 
 

SkinData* getSkinData (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Returns:
The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

void removeElements (   ) 
 

void select (   ) 
 

Adds this item to the set of selected items of the tree field, if the item is not yet selected.

If it does not belong to a multi select tree field, all other items are unselected.

void setExpanded (  bool  expanded,
bool  deeply = false

void setFieldAndParent (  TreeField *  field,
TreeField::Item *  parent
)  [protected]
 

void setModel (  void *  model,
void(*  modelDestructor)(void *model) = NULL
)  [inherited]
 

Sets the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Parameters:
model The application (or game) defined data.
modelDestructor An optional static method that is called, whenever the glaziery object is destroyed or when a new model is set. Specify this function only, if the model must be destroyed by this glaziery object, i.e. the object "owns" the model. If the model is a glaziery object itself, you may use the GlazieryObject::destructor() function.
See also:
destructor()

virtual void setSkinData (  SkinData *  skinData  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Sets the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Parameters:
skinData The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

Any previously set skin data is automatically destroyed.

Reimplemented in Component.

virtual String toString (   )  [virtual, inherited]

Returns:
The string representation.

Reimplemented in ClientArea, CachableComponent, Component, Desktop, Dialog, Button, CheckBox, Field, GroupField, ImageField, KeyStrokeField, Label, ListField::RowsField, ListField, ProgressBar, RadioBox, Selector, Slider, Spacer, TabbingField, TextField, TreeField, MenuBar, Popup, Scene, Widget, and Window.

void unselect (   ) 
 

Removes this item from the set of selected items.

Vector updateDeepSize (  Vector  offset  )  [protected]
 

Updates the size of the item including its children and element and item spaces.

Also updates the position and size properties of the item.

Parameters:
offset The start position for calculating positions.
Returns:
The deep size of the item.

Vector position [private]
 

A cache of the position of this tree item, relative to the tree field.

This cache is automatically updated on tree field changes, e.g. item expansion.

Definition at line 143 of file TreeField.h.

Vector size [private]
 

A cache of the size of this tree item, including children, if expanded.

This cache is automatically updated on tree field changes, e.g. item expansion.
